posts.cooked: I would like to listen Spotify while building AI.

posts.name: Aniculescu
posts.cooked: This seems like a general Ubuntu issue as DGX OS is built on Ubuntu 24.04. You would need to direct your question to others for this
Not sure if I understand this response, I have ubuntu 24.04 in three linux machines with intel or amd processors and all have support for widevine cdm…. this is very specific of DGX Spark and arm

posts.name: Aniculescu
posts.cooked: What issue or error message are you seeing? More specific information would be appreciated

“Playback of protected content is not enabled” error message

This message is in Firefox browser, and in the spotify instructions to solve this problem they say:

Click Enable DRM in the yellow warning bar at the top of the screen.

If you don’t see the yellow bar:

In your browser address bar, enter about:preferences#content
Under DRM content, switch on Play DRM.

but this option does not exist in Firefox in DGX Spark but it does exists in Ubuntu 24.04 in the Intel/AMD versions
btw, the same problem happens in a raspberry pi…

posts.name: Haidij
posts.cooked:
If you have a device with DRM (like your phone) and Spotify installed you can stream to DGX Spark using spotifyd: GitHub - Spotifyd/spotifyd: A spotify daemon

Since I needed the usb ports for peripherals I plugged my speaker system into my monitor and output the sound to that.

You may need to do this to get it working:

adding 0.0.0.0 apresolve.spotify.com to /etc/hosts as suggested here fixed it!

github.com/Spotifyd/spotifyd

Track should be available, but no alternatives found.

opened 10:44PM - 17 Sep 25 UTC
closed 07:24AM - 19 Sep 25 UTC
japhias
bug

**Description** I have done my first installation of spotifyd. It is up and runn…ing. I can discover it in my spotify app. I can start a song in the app, it seems to play, but you can hear nothing. I have installed spotifyd as a systemwide config. I'm logged into spotify with a family premium account **Logs** Sep 17 23:35:10 raspberrypi spotifyd[515]: [INFO] Resolved 50 tracks from <"spotify:album:2T3Ukt8O4eGHh6S8EEQ1B8"> Sep 17 23:35:10 raspberrypi spotifyd[515]: [ERROR] Track should be available, but no alternatives found. Sep 17 23:35:10 raspberrypi spotifyd[515]: [WARN] <spotify:track:4MGU5WByj7KXgyY2hEHBAA> is not available Can someone please help me?

link_counts.title: Track should be available, but no alternatives found. · Issue #1366 · Spotifyd/spotifyd · GitHub

posts.name: Aniculescu
posts.cooked: It seems there is no publicly available Widevine for 64-bit ARM based systems. It seems some people have been able to get around it though you may have to do some searching.

posts.name: Haidij
posts.cooked: Just to add since this broke, the new way to fix it is here: Fix "Track should be available, but no alternatives found." · Issue #1370 · Spotifyd/spotifyd · GitHub
